Phase 2.2: Convert Rate Limiter to PeriodicTask
description: Replace manual token refill scheduling with PeriodicTask. Current approach uses complex state tracking and manual scheduling. New approach uses PeriodicTask for automatic periodic refills. Benefits: automatic periodic refills, cleaner code structure, no manual scheduling logic, self-managing lifecycle. Estimated effort: 3-4 hours. Risk: Medium.
notes: After analysis, the current rate limiter implementation is already well-designed for DES. It uses on-demand token calculation based on elapsed simulation time, which is more efficient and accurate than periodic refills. Converting to PeriodicTask would add unnecessary periodic events and make it less efficient. The current approach is deterministic, efficient, and follows DES best practices by calculating state on-demand rather than using periodic updates.
